text.title: part2_Former 'Top Model' contestant Whitney Cunningham defends plus size models, celebrates the "regular woman"

p.s: Did Tyra encourage a certain standard among the girls ( weight or otherwise ) that was unhealthy ?
Not at all .
I think that viewers think that we have a whole lot more interaction with Tyra than we actually do .
We only really saw her during panel and during our " interventions .
" [ laughs ]
Do you think Tyra still believes her show is about finding " the next top model " even though none of the show 's winners have had that success ?
That is a phenomenal question .
I do n't think that the show gives its winners enough time to reign .
The show puts out two cycles a year .
While one cycle is airing , they are taping another and apparently the show is scheduled to continue until 2010 !
I think it was about finding a " Top Model " during the show 's beginnings , but I think that Ã¼ber-success of the show has turned it into a profit-driven production .

I just wish that the show would put more time and cultivation into their winners even
after
their cycle 's conclusions .
And I truly think that the show would see a return on cultivating their winners , because the show 's credibility would increase .
A fan wrote in to ask , " What struggles did you face on the show as a plus sized model ?
I think that my biggest struggle was realizing that plus sized models and straight sized models are apples and oranges ...

I could n't study magazines and try to develop my poses , because a woman who weighs 110 pounds and is 5'10 " looks completely different when she shapes and curves her body than a woman who is 5'10 " and weighs 175 pounds .
I , therefore , had to figure things out as I went along .
The other girls had a reference/vantage point to learn from .
I 'm still figuring things out .

Do you think it was unfair for Tyra to ask that [ studying magazines and developing your poses ] of you and Diana , considering that even though she 's fuller-figured now , she has a lot more experience under her belt than you two did ?
Well , you know , I would say that it would have been fair if there were magazines for us to study !
But there were none .
That 's why I think that it 's so important that publications like Plus Model Magazine continue to blossom and flourish .
I 've learned more reading that magazine and getting to know the folks who write for that magazine than I ever learned about being a plus-sized model on ANTM .
P.S. I 'll be gracing the cover of that magazine in January of ' 08 .
Look out for me .
It sounds like you 're doing just fine for yourself .
Which one fan also asked , " Have you faced adversity about your weight since being on the show ?
